alert.note: Alert for Coastal Hancock; Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Hancock and south central Penobscot Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 315 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hampden, or 12 miles southwest of Bangor, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bangor, Ellsworth, Bucksport, Blue Hill, Brewer, Hampden, Hermon, Veazie, Dedham, Verona Island, Penobscot Township, Orrington, Holden, Carmel, Orland, Eddington, Newburgh, Bradley, Surry and Etna. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 168 and 187. US Highway 1 near Orland. State Highway 9 between Dixmont and Clifton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Hancock; Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot
